title: Comment on "These 11 kids were shot with guns found at home"
content:
Wayne County Prosecutor Kym Worthy on May 25, 2016 charged the grandparents of a 5-year-old girl who allegedly went into their bedroom, found a handgun beneath a pillow, brought it into another room and shot herself in the neck.
Frederick Davis and Patricia McNeal, both 65 and of Detroit, were charged with involuntary manslaughter, three counts of second-degree child abuse and felony firearm.
The following slides contain data provided by the prosecutor's office highlighting Wayne County child shooting cases going back to 2014 that involved unsecured guns found by children.
